title: Adele gushes about 'amazing' 2016 at BRIT Awards
text:
She revealed she had finally married her long-term partner Simon Konecki at the Grammy Awards earlier this month.
And Adele was quick to admit that the last year had been her 'best yet' as she graciously accepted the Global Success Award at the BRITs .
The 28-year-old, who is currently on tour in Australia, appeared at London 's O2 Arena via video link to thank her fans for the honour - admitting that 2016 had been 'amazing' in light of both her personal and professional milestones.
Delighted: Adele was quick to admit that the last year had been her 'best yet' as she graciously accepted the Global Success Award at the BRITs
Happy news: Her claim that the year had been 'amazing' follows both her professional successes and secret marriage to long-term partner Simon Konecki (above)
The Rumour Has It singer scored the prestigious Global Success Award after the successful reception to her album 25 - which sold over 20 million copies worldwide.
Talking through a video stream from Sydney, the songstress said in an emotional thank you to fans after her win: 'Hello London, thank you so much it means the world to me.
'You have all been amazing to me this past year. It’s been amazing this year, the best one yet. Have a good time!' before adding in her playful style: 'Get a bit swervy like her!' as she gestured to her trophy.
Overwhelmed: Talking through a video stream from Sydney, the songstress said in an emotional thank you after her win: 'Hello London, thank you so much it means the world to me'
Clearly grateful for the recognition, she later took to her Twitter to explain her absence, writing graciously: 'Thank you @BRITS. I actually am on the other side, of the world! I'm in Australia, that's why I'm not there. Have a great night x'
While she bagged her third chart-topping record worldwide, the British beauty also saw an exciting personal milestone this year - having married long-term partner Simon Konecki.
Known for remaining tight-lipped about her personal life, Adele only announced her marriage to the charity founded after referring to him as her 'husband' while collecting her Album of the Year Grammy award.
Taking to the stage at the Staples Center in Los Angeles the hitmaker had said to the audience: 'Grammys, I appreciate it, the Academy, I love you, my manager, my husband and my son – you’re the only reason I do it.'
Over the moon: She continued to gush: 'You have all been amazing to me this past year. It’s been amazing this year, the best one yet. Have a good time!'
Adele met Simon, who started Drop4Drop, back in 2011 - and the pair share four-year-old son Angelo together.
The star admitted in a recent intimate interview with OK ! that she is already hoping to instill gentlemanly values in her son, born in October 2012, despite his tender age.
She said to the magazine: 'I'm raising him to respect women. He knows I'm a powerful force.'
'He feels it at home, let alone when he comes to work with me. And he comes everywhere with me anyway!'
Reason to celebrate: While she bagged her third chart-topping record worldwide, the British beauty also saw an exciting personal milestone this year - having married long-term partner Simon Konecki
Confirming that the pair are joined at the hip, Adele was seen touching down in Sydney, Australia on Sunday for the next leg of her tour - with her sweet boy wrapped around her shoulders.
It is no wonder Adele received the Global Success Award at the bash, after her latest record 25 became the fastest-selling album ever in the UK.
The 37th BRIT Awards ceremony 2017 features a star-studded line-up with Katy Perry, Ed Sheeran, Robbie Williams, Little Mix, Bruno Mars, The 1975, Emeli Sandé and Skepta all taking the stage.
Adele will also be hoping to replicate a tiny slice of her recent Grammy success by scooping the British Artist Video Of The Year award for Send My Love (To Your New Lover).
However, she faces a tough contest with Calvin Harris Feat. Rihanna, whose video for This Is What You Came For has been a frontrunner with the bookies.

Between the BAFTA Awards and the Grammys, it's been a night full of amazing red-carpet outfits!
One of our favourite looks at the BAFTAs was The Duchess Of Cambridge in a beautiful Bardot dress by Alexander McQueen, but Adele is definitely the best-dressed at the Grammys in our eyes.
Her gorgeous Givenchy dress hails from the autumn/winter '16 collection, although she's had it customised and added long sleeves. We love this olive shade on her and it's nice to see the talented singer mix things up on the red-carpet.
She often wears a bit of sparkle at awards and favours brands like Burberry (who designed the stage outfits for her recent tour), Jenny Packham and Valentino, but we're glad she's given Givenchy a go this time!
